title: Which famous guitarists were self-taught? - Quora

response.answer_text: What guitarists that are household names were self-taught? Very many, if not most, in rock & pop, if you mean lacked formal, paid lessons. Or, nearly none, as it’s extremely rare for one to get really good in total isolation. I’ve been grinding away this “self-taught” thing for years, but it persists. To go one more time, nearly all players learn from other players. The choice is not paid lessons vs. “self-taught”. It’s the distance from the teacher, and their quality. Sit-down pro lessons, sit-down unpaid coaching from a better player, then recorded approaches, like books, CD’s, DVD’s, YouTube, etc. - which sever the personal touch and interactivity of the sit-down. Yes, there are some who never had much for instruction - but mainly listened to hundred of hours of music, not just the wind blowing thru the trees. Here’s somebody who might be worth listening to:

Jimi Hendrix, Eric Clapton and Prince – three of the all-time greats – all claim to be self-taught guitarists. Even John Lennon and Paul McCartney were largely self-taught musicians. John Frusciante – guitarist for the Red Hot Chilli Peppers
